greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the least k >= A007947(n) such that -n + k and (n-sigma(n))+k are relatively prime.
comment: a(n) is the least k >= A007947(n) such that n-k and n-(sigma(n)-k) are relatively prime.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: A325971(n) = { my(s=sigma(n)); for(i=A007947(n), s, if(1==gcd(n-i, n-(s-i)), return(i))); (0); };
A325971(n) = { my(s=sigma(n)); for(k=A007947(n), s, if(1==gcd(-n + k, (n-sigma(n))+k), return(k))); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 31 2019
